channel.title: Support - Kicksecure Forums
channel.description: Topics in the 'Support' category User support for the Kicksecure operating system.

item.title: Followed wiki but get error for Whonix install
item.dc:creator: whonix
item.description:
Followed wiki and setup kicksecure correctly, on the last leg to install whonix I followed the only command per the wiki (kicksecure/wiki/Whonix) being: whonix-xfce-installer-cli

I get this error:
whonix-xfce-installer-cli: [ERROR]: Installer exited with code: ‘1’
zsh: exit 1 whonix-xfce-installer-cli

Any Help would be appreciated.

Thanks

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Followed wiki but get error for Whonix install

item.title: Updating/upgrading as user without being in sudo group?
item.dc:creator: Crawfish
item.description:
So the way I installed Kicksecure was without granting root rights to user to lock it down better.
How can I make it so user can still do upgrade-nonroot without adding user to the sudo group?

Would changing the permissions to the upgrade-nonroot and apt-get-update-plus achieve this?

chmod 755 /usr/bin/upgrade-nonroot

chmod 755 /usr/bin/apt-get-update-plus

Would this be a stupid idea? (just want to be able to use user to update/upgrade not install packages)

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Updating/upgrading as user without being in sudo group?

item.title: How can I use podman rootlessly?
item.dc:creator: user1
item.description:
How can I use podman without root? I installed podman with sudo apt install podman -y

It works fine when I use sudo, like sudo podman ps, but when I try to run something with podman without root privileges like podman ps I get:
ERRO[0000] running /usr/bin/newuidmap 3450 0 1000 1 1 100000 65536: Error: cannot set up namespace using "/usr/bin/newuidmap": should have setuid or have filecaps setuid: fork/exec /usr/bin/newuidmap: permission denied zsh: exit 125 podman ps

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: How can I use podman rootlessly?

item.title: Enable user Namespace concern
item.dc:creator: SteveK1978
item.description:
I want to run podman containers rootlessly. It requires enable user.max_user_namespace. If I change the value to user.max_user_namespac=15000 how does that effect security?

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic

item.title: Why does Kicksecure requires a user with username user?
item.dc:creator: SteveK1978
item.description:
Why does Kicksecure requires a user with username user rather then anything else?
I want to create a separate Kicksecure secure hardened and no-login user(like www-data for Apache) to run Containers(podman, Docker or LXC), Proxmox or any other software.
The user already have too much privileges and I want to avoid from using it.
What should I do?

4 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Why does Kicksecure requires a user with username user?

item.title: Would randomizing machine-id each boot cause issues?
item.dc:creator: Crawfish
item.description:
Is there any reasons as to not randomize the machine-id?
Would it break systemd and or tirdad for example?

I see that Whonix and Kicksecure both set the machine-id as:

b08dfa6083e7567a1921a715000001fb

Could something like dbus-uuidgen --ensure=/etc/machine-id or systemd-machine-id-setup be used on startup to create new machine each boot without issue?

5 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Would randomizing machine-id each boot cause issues?

item.title: Wanting some information
item.dc:creator: anon28548764
item.description:
I’m new to this and I’m a bit confused about the differences between Kicksecure and Debian. Can someone please explain this to me and suggest some resources where I can learn more about it?

Additionally, if any forum members have recommendations on where to find more information on how Kicksecure sources.list work, please share them with me. I understand that Kicksecure is designed to enhance the security of Debian.

I had some issues, where fixed by reading over the install guide again.

3 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Hardening Parrot (Home Edition)
item.dc:creator: lavontay
item.description:
Trying to apply kicksecure’s hardenings to Parrot Home edition (Vbox), but i ran into some problems. Here is the output:
sudo apt install --no-install-recommends kicksecure-cli-vm
Reading package lists… Done
Building dependency tree… Done
Reading state information… Done
Some packages could not be installed. This may mean that you have
requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable
distribution that some required packages have not yet been created
or been moved out of Incoming.
The following information may help to resolve the situation:

The following packages have unmet dependencies:
kicksecure-recommended-cli : Depends: libblockdev-crypto2 but it is not installable
plymouth : Conflicts: console-common but 0.7.91 is to be installed
: Error, pkgProblemResolver::Resolve generated breaks, this may be caused by held packages.

Already tried and searched for many solutions, but none of them really solved my problem. Someone can help me?

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Sudoers issue problem
item.dc:creator: wiw65712
item.description:
debian 12
kicksecure GUI
i unable to tun systemcheck and time sync and tor (nyx is not present though )

unable to open /run/sudo/ts/user: Permission denied sudo: a password is required

my user is in sudo group … do i need password less sudo group access %sudo ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD: ALL ?? to make things work ?

item.title: Kicksecure Breaks permissions in Debian 12
item.dc:creator: adamtheant
item.description:
After installing kicksecure, I am no longer able to save files via programm installed, and run, under a user account.

I only have one primary account, and I cannot get programs executed under said account to execute with same privileges.

so bug in kicksecure, and how to fix please?

6 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Kicksecure breaks NFS
item.dc:creator: adamtheant
item.description:
on a debian 12 install, I configured NFS for use on my local LAN. I did intsall network-manager-gnome and openvpn…

after my client was able to mount the remote (local LAN). after installing kicksecure, I cannot get them to connect.

connection timeout when trying to mount from the command line.

I have double shecked hosts.allow and exports on the server, but they didnt seem to have been altered by installing kicksecure.

I DO have multiple NIC installed (4). 2 in use to WAN via router1, and 1 in use to router2 (local LAN)

portlist shows tcp 2049
rpcinfo shows
portmapper ports 111 TCP & UDP for versions 2,3,4
nfs ports 2049 TCP versions 3 & 4, and a nfs_acl on 2049 for version 3

ideally i would prefer to have an IP or MAC verified w/o kerberos, but I will take what I can at the moment I cant get mount working…

3 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Live mode menu does not appear after clean install
item.dc:creator: discuspi
item.description:
Please help me solve the problem

Clean installation of Debian 12 standard - subsequent distro-morphing in Kicksecure-XFCE exactly according to the instructions
The Live mode menu does not appear

checking the installation:

 dpkg -l | grep grub-live
ii  grub-live                                     3:4.9-1                              all          grub live boot menu entry
ii  grub-live-initramfs-tools                     3:4.9-1                              all          grub live initramfs-tools dependencies

That’s where the problem seems to be

sudo update-grub

[sudo] password for user:                      
Generating grub configuration file ...
Found linux image: /boot/vmlinuz-6.1.0-18-amd64
Found initrd image: /boot/initrd.img-6.1.0-18-amd64
grub-live /etc/grub.d/11_linux_live: ERROR: It has been detected that this system is using dracut but but file /usr/lib/dracut/modules.d/90overlay-root/overlay-mount.sh is not executable. This means that no live mode boot menu entry will be added.

Warning: os-prober will not be executed to detect other bootable partitions.
Systems on them will not be added to the GRUB boot configuration.
Check GRUB_DISABLE_OS_PROBER documentation entry.
Adding boot menu entry for UEFI Firmware Settings ...
done

when I trying sudo apt install --no-install-recommends dracut and then sudo update-grub, a menu appears but the system does not boot

My goal is just to get a working Kicksecure system on a USB flash drive with LIVE mode

Please tell me the easiest way to get such a system

13 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Live mode menu does not appear after clean install

item.title: How is Kicksecure working with Openstack?
item.dc:creator: SteveK1978
item.description:
Is there anyone using or tried to use Kicksecure to run Openstack? How is Kicksecure working with Openstack components? Are they working fine? Please share your experience with it!
I was looking for a security oriented Debian-based distro as my Linux server to host Openstack undercloud, overcloud and guest VM as servers for our service. I just want to know your experience on working with it as a server.
Thanks!

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic

item.title: How to install minimal Kicksecure
item.dc:creator: SteveK1978
item.description:
How do I install a minimal Kicksecure environment? I don’t need Tor, fonts or xserver but kicksecure-cli force me to install a lot of unnecessary packages. Is there anyway that allows me to install a minimal Kicksecure environment? I also don’t need swap at all, why it creates a swap partition for me?
I think we need a kicksecure-minimum metapackage without Tor, fonts or any thing like p7zip or libgtk.

4 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Security-misc breaks network connectivity
item.dc:creator: SteveK1978
item.description:
Hi all,
I installed these packages on my Debian 12 VirtualBox VM: lkrg* ufw hardened-runtime hardened-malloc-kicksecure-enable hardened-malloc apparmor-utils apparmor-profiles-kicksecure* sandbox-app-luncher and everything works fine.
After I checked everything is working after reboot, I rebooted it again and installed security-misc and both of my network interfaces goes down. Please help me!

11 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Updating Kicksecure to 17.1.1.5 breaks grub-live
item.dc:creator: kivk
item.description:
Hi. After updating Kicksecure to 17.1.1.5 live mode menu has disappeared from the boot menu. The issue is confirmed to exist both on Kicksecure and Whonix. Here’s a log I got by trying to reinstall grub-live:

user@localhost:~$ sudo apt install --reinstall grub-live
[sudo] password for user:                 
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree... Done
Reading state information... Done
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 1 reinstalled, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
Need to get 0 B/22.7 kB of archives.
After this operation, 0 B of additional disk space will be used.
(Reading database ... 123198 files and directories currently installed.)
Preparing to unpack .../grub-live_3%3a4.9-1_all.deb ...
Unpacking grub-live (3:4.9-1) over (3:4.9-1) ...
Setting up grub-live (3:4.9-1) ...
Generating grub configuration file ...
Found linux image: /boot/vmlinuz-6.1.0-17-amd64
Found initrd image: /boot/initrd.img-6.1.0-17-amd64
Found linux image: /boot/vmlinuz-5.10.0-23-amd64
Found initrd image: /boot/initrd.img-5.10.0-23-amd64
grub-live /etc/grub.d/11_linux_live: ERROR: It has been detected that this syste
m is using dracut but but file /usr/lib/dracut/modules.d/90overlay-root/overlay-
mount.sh is not executable. This means that no live mode boot menu entry will be
 added.

done
user@localhost:~$

15 posts - 4 participants

Read full topic
